cliché.translation[0].definitions[0].def: an idea or phrase that has been used so much that it is not effective or does not have any meaning any longer
cliché.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: There is plenty of truth in the cliché that a trouble shared is a trouble halved.
cliché.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He seemed to believe that old cliché about a woman’s place being in the home.
The story is based on a series of tired clichés.
His writing is full of worn-out clichés.
The term 'information revolution' is a popular cliché.
Giving a girl red roses is a bit of a romantic cliché.
'Time marches on', to use the old cliché.
Sports reporting tends to be full of clichés.
It has become a cliché to say that Prague is the most beautiful city in Europe.
